group.name: The Power of XML
group.sample: A couple of existing web sites have been xml-ized to show you how easier it is to handle pure-content markup.
An example of more complex use of XSLT for navigation and content filtering.
Separation of content and style allows not only to serve your content in different ways, but also to syndicate, aggregate or otherwise include and transform content provided by other web sites.

XML is handy but also very complex. Cocoon integrates a number of facilities to help you during your journey through XML-land. One of these is the centralized handling of resolving network resources (e.g. DTDs, symbols, character entity sets, images) to local copies through the use of catalogs. Also explains how to use DocBook DTDs.
